name: Bonamia_eustachioi
distribution: Bahia (Brazil Northeast, Brazil, Southern America);Minas Gerais (Brazil Southeast, Brazil, Southern America);

remarks: doi:10.1007/s12228-021-09662-z The specific epithet honours the collector Jair Eustáquio Quintino de Faria Júnior, taxonomist and specialist in the flora of the Cerrado.

name: Cuscuta_mantiqueirana
distribution: Minas Gerais (Brazil Southeast, Brazil, Southern America);Rio de Janeiro (Brazil Southeast, Brazil, Southern America);São Paulo (Brazil Southeast, Brazil, Southern America);
typeLocations: holotype SP;isotype K;isotype MBM;isotype NY;isotype R;isotype SPF;isotype UB;isotype UEC;isotype WLU
remarks: Etymology: 'The specific epithet is a feminine adjective that comes from the name of the mountain range to which the species is apparently endemic. The word 'Mantiqueira' is derived from Tupi-Guarani meaning 'mountains that cry' alluding perhaps to the plethora of dripping water, streams and rivers that are present during the wet season with abundant rainfall'. doi:10.3897/phytokeys.184.69037
locality: Minas Gerais: Camanducaia, Monte Verde. Parasita com ramos desde alaranjados até vináceos, sempre em local sombreado e humido

name: Dicranostyles_yrypoana
distribution: Amazonas (Brazil North, Brazil, Southern America);Pará (Brazil North, Brazil, Southern America);
typeLocations: holotype MG MG037197;isotype MO MO2019593;isotype NY NY01922603
remarks: doi:10.1600/036364423X16758873924126 Etymology: 'The specific epithet refers to yripo which means liana in the language of Satere-Mawe people'.
locality: Pará: Santarem, Km 35 da estrada do Palhão [PA-370], arredores do acampamento do Igarape Curupira

name: Evolvulus_aureus
distribution: Bahia (Brazil Northeast, Brazil, Southern America);Goiás (Brazil West-Central, Brazil, Southern America);
